poem:
**Hecklers in the Wings**

Nigel paced the stage, a mouthful of promises,
while hecklers became sudden constellations,
each burst of outrage a flash in the dark.
Security swarmed, silenced their starlight,
and the hall returned to a murmur,
ever so close to revolution, yet bound
by the gravity of routine applause.

Several men and women were thrown out by security as they took it in turns to stand up and disrupt the event featuring Farage and three fellow MPs". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
